definition: to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing
to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive

sentences.english: He drained all the old oil out of the container.
sentences.chinese: 他把容器里积存的油全部倒出来了。

sentences.english: China says the quota cuts will prevent reckless and polluting mining of deposits.
sentences.chinese: 中国政府称配额削减是为了避免鲁莽的开采积存污染。

sentences.english: We carried over a large sum of money for next year.
sentences.chinese: 我们积存一大笔钱留到明年用。

sentences.english: Another way to increase a stock is to reduce the outflow.
sentences.chinese: 另一种方法是通过降低流出量来增加积存量。

sentences.english: The drain will plug up if you let grease settle in it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你让油脂积存，排水管就会堵塞。

sentences.english: Holika also signifies the dirt and filth that collects during the winter months.
sentences.chinese: 霍利嘉也象征着冬季里积存了的污垢。

sentences.english: The prime minister says he's determined to take on long-standing social problems.
sentences.chinese: 卡梅伦表示他决心解决积存已久的社会问题。

sentences.english: In addition, melamine and its analogs are not known to accumulate in the animals.
sentences.chinese: 此外，三聚氰胺及类似物质据知并不在家畜体内积存。

sentences.english: Well, maybe not closer, but you might want to refrain from making enemies in the first place: Research suggests that holding grudges is a quick ticket to unhappiness.
sentences.chinese: 研究表明积存怨恨是一条通往不幸福的捷径。

definition: to clear away/to eliminate/to get rid of
to drain (factory waste etc)/to excrete (urine, sweat etc)
to stock up/to lay in supplies/to hoard (for speculation)/to corner the market in sth
